sourceMeaningMnemonic: There’s a <radical>tree</radical> in the <radical>east</radical> that looks like a <kanji>pillar</kanji>. The tree is tall and straight and does not have any leaves or branches. The tree is basically a big wooden pillar that just happens to be alive still.
meaningInfo: Look at this big tree pillar over in the east. You always know where east is because of it.
readingMnemonic: That <kanji>pillar</kanji> happens to be in the center of <ja><reading>とう</reading>きょう</ja>. If you need to find east (which is where <ja>とうきょう</ja> is), you just look for the pillar.
readingInfo: Imagine looking down on <ja>とうきょう</ja> from atop this magnificent pillar. The sun is rising behind you, slowly illuminating the city below.
